Attunement requires you to swear an oath aloud to the artifact (it remembers the exact words).
Attunement requires you to sacrifice a cherished memory; choose one significant personal memory—its details become hazy forever.
Attunement requires you to spill your blood onto the artifact (you take 1d6 necrotic damage that ignores resistance).
Attunement requires you to refuse aid to at least one creature in need each week.
Attunement requires you to keep the artifact’s name secret; if you speak it aloud, you lose attunement at the next dawn.
Attunement requires you to mark a map with a place you fear and then travel within 1 mile of it.
Attunement requires you to destroy a mundane object of value (at least 50 gp) during the ritual.
